tool.name: Tool

param.name: in_workspace
param.pythonReference: folder for resulting geodatabase to be located.

param.name: park_distance
param.pythonReference: the distance that will determine the buffer that will select the parcels that will hold a flag value for proximity to parks.

param.name: bus_stop_distance
param.pythonReference: The parameter that will determine the distance in feet from a bus stop that will be used in selecting parcels within a proximity to a metro station. Distance is calculated from a field generated by running the near tool.

param.name: park_weight
param.pythonReference: the relative weight of the park distance in calculating an 'investment index' in relation to the additional weighted attributes.

param.name: bus_weight
param.pythonReference: the relative weight of the bus distance in calculating an 'investment index' in relation to the additional weighted attributes.

param.name: vacant_weight
param.pythonReference: the relative weight of a parcel's vacancy status in calculating an 'investment index' in relation to the additional weighted attributes.

tool.usage: :param parameters:parameter1: Local File folder- specify the directory in which data is to be downloaded and manipulatedThe following two parameters specify the distance from parks and bus stops respectively within which a userhas interest in residential parcels to be redevelopedparameter2: Distance from Park (miles)parameter3: Distance from Bus Stop (feet)The following parameters are the relative weights of the three fields used in the calculation of theinvestment index field. They will default to 1.parameter4: Park weight-weight of the specified distance to parks in index calculationparameter5: Bus weight-weight of the distance to metro stop in index field calculationparameter6: vacant weight-weight of a vacant lot in calculating index.:return: This tool returns two geodatabases to the file directory specified in parameter 1. One contains all the layers manipulated within this tool and the other contains only the resulting two layers of interest. The layers returned in the 'Results' geodatabase contain a feature class for all the residential redevelopment plots with flag values for distance specified from parks and buses, and a flag for vacant lots. There is also a field for the sum of all three flags. The 2nd feature class returned is an interpolated diffusion surface of the estimated value assessment for all residential parcels in Madison.
tool.summary: Use this tool to determine desired residential parcels for redevelopment in Madison Wisconsin by determining a desired distance from parks and bus stops.
